intro: Isidorea tetramera, commonly known as the four-leaf isidorea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a rough texture. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in the spring. The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
